title: fix(da-indexer): Add chunking for Celestia blobs
body:
This PR modifies `da-indexer`: adds chunking when writing Celestia blobs to database to avoid exceeding postgres limit for one inserting operation.

For that, the `DA_INDEXER__INDEXER__DA__CELESTIA__SAVE_BATCH_SIZE` env variable was added (recommended value is 1000).

Also, some env variables `DA_INDEXER__INDEXER__DA__*` were renamed so that they correspond to another deserialization mechanism allowing setting numeric values for envs (previously, such values were treated as strings):

- `DA_INDEXER__INDEXER__DA__RPC__URL` -> `DA_INDEXER__INDEXER__DA__CELESTIA__RPC__URL` or `DA_INDEXER__INDEXER__DA__EIGENDA__RPC__URL`
- `DA_INDEXER__INDEXER__DA__RPC__AUTH_TOKEN` -> `DA_INDEXER__INDEXER__DA__CELESTIA__RPC__AUTH_TOKEN`
- `DA_INDEXER__INDEXER__DA__START_HEIGHT` -> `DA_INDEXER__INDEXER__DA__CELESTIA__START_HEIGHT`

- `DA_INDEXER__INDEXER__DA__DISPERSER_URL` -> `DA_INDEXER__INDEXER__DA__EIGENDA__DISPERSER_URL`
- `DA_INDEXER__INDEXER__DA__EIGENDA_ADDRESS` -> `DA_INDEXER__INDEXER__DA__EIGENDA__ADDRESS`
- `DA_INDEXER__INDEXER__DA__EIGENDA_CREATION_BLOCK` -> `DA_INDEXER__INDEXER__DA__EIGENDA__CREATION_BLOCK`
- `DA_INDEXER__INDEXER__DA__RPC__BATCH_SIZE` -> `DA_INDEXER__INDEXER__DA__EIGENDA__RPC__BATCH_SIZE`
- `DA_INDEXER__INDEXER__DA__START_BLOCK` -> `DA_INDEXER__INDEXER__DA__EIGENDA__START_BLOCK`
- `DA_INDEXER__INDEXER__DA__SAVE_BATCH_SIZE` -> `DA_INDEXER__INDEXER__DA__EIGENDA__SAVE_BATCH_SIZE`
- `DA_INDEXER__INDEXER__DA__PRUNING_BLOCK_THRESHOLD` -> `DA_INDEXER__INDEXER__DA__EIGENDA__PRUNING_BLOCK_THRESHOLD`


<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - Upgraded the core environment to a newer OS version with enhanced package handling.
  - Introduced a configurable parameter to manage batch processing during data operations.
  
- **Documentation**
  - Updated configuration keys and environment variable names for clearer setup and improved consistency.
  
- **Enhancements**
  - Optimized data handling by processing tasks in smaller segments, contributing to improved performance and stability.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: feat(multi): enhance multichain search api
body:
* Add `/nfts` endpoint - paginated list view similar to address search but only across NFT tokens (ERC-721/ERC-1155).
* Add `/transactions` endpoint - paginated list view of `Hashes` with `transaction` type.
* Add `/chains` endpoint - list chains supported by the service.
* Add `/marketplace/chains`, `/marketplace/categories` endpoints - proxy to corresponding marketplace service endpoints with additional validation. `/marketplace/chains` also maps chain ids to corresponding chain's name and url.
*  Update `/search:quick` endpoint response. Now, search results across all supported chains are simply stored in a `Vec` without mapping them to a dedicated chain's struct.

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

## Release Notes

### New Features
- Added support for chain names in the database and API.
- Introduced new API endpoints for:
	- Listing transactions.
	- Listing NFTs.
	- Listing chains.
	- Listing decentralized applications (dapps) and their categories.
- Enhanced search functionality with improved pagination and result structures.

### Improvements
- Refactored repository and service modules for better code organization.
- Updated search result handling to provide more flexible and detailed responses.
- Improved database query mechanisms with cursor-based pagination.
- Streamlined type conversions and error handling.

### Database Changes
- Added optional `name` column to chains table.
- Updated migration support for new database schema.

### API Changes
- New gRPC and REST endpoints for listing various entities.
- Modified quick search response to include more detailed information.
- Updated response formats for addresses, tokens, and search results.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

  - Added a new `/api/v1/status` endpoint to retrieve the current indexer status.
  - Implemented real-time status tracking for user operations indexing.
  - Enhanced indexer with detailed status reporting for different entry point versions.

- **Improvements**
  - Refined indexing logic for better error handling and status communication.
  - Improved configuration settings with more flexible default values.
  - Added support for tracking past and real-time indexing progress.
  - Introduced new environment variables for enhanced configurability.

- **Technical Enhancements**
  - Introduced a status messaging system for indexer operations.
  - Updated API and protocol definitions to support new status reporting.
  - Implemented thread-safe status tracking mechanisms.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: feat(eth-bytecode-db): integrate verifier_alliance schema v1
body:
Closes https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout-rs/issues/1108

Integrates updated `verifier-alliance-migration`, `verifier-alliance-entity` and `verifier-alliance-database` crates to integrate v1 alliance schema into eth-bytecode-db service

Changes left to the next PRs:
1. `check_match_statuses` function (validating that inserted verification data is not worse than existing ones) was removed in this PR, and will be returned later into `verifier-alliance-database` crate.
2. Integration verifier alliance tests checking authorization scenarios have been commented out and will be re-written in the PR updating tests structure


<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
	- Added support for Verifier Alliance database testing framework.
	- Enhanced contract verification and matching capabilities.

title: fix(launcher): database macros with custom_prefix
body:

title: feat(stats): dynamic indexing status wait
body:
Start chart updates dynamically when next indexed status is observed. Basically makes launching the statistics service more convenient and simple.
Also fixed a strange behaviour when scheduled updates occured before the initial update had a chance to start

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

# Release Notes

- **New Features**
  - Introduced a new `IndexingStatus` enum to manage chart data indexing requirements.
  - Added indexing status tracking and management across multiple components.
  - Enhanced data source and chart update mechanisms with indexing status checks.
  - Added a new method to compute indexing status requirements for update groups.
  - Introduced new methods for indexing status requirements in various chart properties.
  - Added a method in `RuntimeSetup` to compute indexing status requirements for all members.
  - Implemented new methods for indexing status in the `DataSource` trait.
  - Added a method in `LocalDbChartSource` to retrieve indexing status requirements.

- **Improvements**
  - Refactored blockscout indexing status monitoring.
  - Improved error handling and logging for update services.
  - Added more granular control over chart data retrieval based on indexing status.
  - Enhanced documentation for service functionality and configuration.
  - Streamlined the test setup process for greater clarity and efficiency.

- **Technical Updates**
  - Restructured update service and server initialization.
  - Implemented asynchronous task management for indexing and updates.
  - Enhanced modularity in status tracking and listener mechanisms.
  - Updated settings management to include new indexing status requirements.
  - Simplified test configuration management and initialization.
